column4: is there a way i can list all of the applications i have installed?
umm... like stuff i installed from synaptic, i think i installed some things that I can't find
ok... how do i unplug my iPod when it says "do not disconnect" and also I lost a drive of music, is there any program i can use to download from my iPod (including filenames and tags etc.)
you should unmount it before you unplug it
i have heard good things about the music player software Rhythmbox and Amarok. there is also a software called gtk-pod
ok, thnx, rythmbox started up when i plugged in, but dragging and dropping didn't work... prolly have to read eh? i think i may be able to use anapod in xp tho
try other ways than drag and drop
gtkpod should work, thanks! i lost like 40 gigs but should be able to recover 8 from my iPod... that took years to convert or collect all that
it is always important to unmount any drive before removing it. pulling the plug on a drive that the OS is accessing will most probably give you trrouble
OK.  trying toi unmount it now, the device appears as /media/SPYPOD, is the device really SPYPOD and not a drive?
just right click it and choose "unmount"
hrm, ok umount says the drive is not mounted according to mtab, but the ipod says not to disconnect
if you insist on doing it in command line, you may have to use sudo
figured it out, thanks and sorry ;p
ok, when i unmount it, the pod still says NO! and there is no ipod folder in /media, but there is a ipod drive showing in computer (with an option to mount)
LOL, i'm so sorry..... eject, right
